html:
Click the following link to watch video: https://share.newscasts.refinitiv.com/link?entryId=1_9byo040l&referenceId=1_9byo040l&pageId=RefinitivNewscasts
Source: Reuters

Description: The Dow has hit a record high, boosted by banks and industrial stocks as worries about the Omicron variant subside. Meanwhile a fall in heavyweight technology stocks dragged the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq indexes lower. Apple once again crossed $3 trillion in market value in early trading before slipping back. Japan's Toyota Motor has dethroned General Motors as the top automaker for sales in America.. Toyota's 2021 sales rose 10% to 2.3 million vehicles. While sales for GM sank 13% to 2.2 million, marking the first time the Detroit automaker has not led U.S. sales since 1931, when it overtook Ford. The U.S. has reported nearly 1 million coronavirus cases in a single day according to a Reuters tally. And they were the must have busy professionals' phone of the early 00s but after years of losing market share to apple and android smartphones, Blackberry has finally pulled the plug on services for it's devices.
Short Link: https://refini.tv/3FPjG2l
